alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 8:46PM AKST until February 21 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 6 PM AKST MONDAY FROM SOLDOTNA TO NIKISKI... * WHAT...Snow, freezing rain, and rain expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. Total ice accumulation up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...From Soldotna to Nikiski on the Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From 9 AM to 6 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will begin as snow Monday morning, then transition to freezing rain and rain from south to north during the afternoon hours. Snow will hold on longest right along Cook Inlet, with the highest accumulation likely in the Nikiski area. Precipitation could then change back to snow Monday night before ending early Tuesday, but expect little or no additional accumulation.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
